section.title: Mobicents Diameter Cx/Dx
section.para: The Cx and Dx interfaces are the reference for interactions between the following servers:

listitem.para: Home Subscriber Server (HSS)
I-CSCF and S-CSCF

section.para: The standard interface is described in the 3GPP Specifications TS29.228 and TS29.229.
The Cx and Dx interfaces provide a number of message commands that can be used within the application.
The Cx and Dx interfaces definition are mixed. This is because both are meant to standardize communication between SIP IMS Proxies and HSS

section.title: Resource Adaptor Type
section.para: The resource adapter provides the following types:

listitem.para: Activities
Provider
Message Factory

formalpara.title: Activities
formalpara.para: The following activities are available, with the API definition listed for reference. The API defines methods to create requests, send and receive answers for a certain activity, and retrieve session-specific data.

section.para: All Cx/Dx activities are short lived - activity is ended after an answer is received or sent.
These activitites allow the Cx/Dx applications to retrieve messagew and AVP factories bound to the current session. The functionality offered is limited only by the implementation used.

formalpara.title: Message Factory
formalpara.para: The Message Factory creates events that can be executed within the JAIN SLEE Server. Depending on the situation, Message Factory completes some AVPs for the session using the information made available to it.

section.para: The API for the DiameterMessageFactory is more than 300 lines, and therefore can not be included directly for reference. To view the API, refer to CxDxMessageFactory.java in the source code.

section.title: Configuration
section.para: Proper configuration includes setting up two instances of jboss. To achieve this please refer to this page. The example also requries proper configuration of mux. The ports and IP address set in its configuration must match those in the example configuration file.

The example is configured via a single file: examples/cxdx/du/src/main/resources/example.properties. Its content are standard for most of the examples. Aside from the ip/port/realm properties, it contains property which controls how the example behaves - client or server mode.
section.programlisting:
# ## # Diameter Cx/Dx Example # ## #
# Act as "client" or "server" (default: server) example.mode=client
# The AS IP Address, Port and Realm (default: 127.0.0.1 / 1812 / mobicents.org) origin.ip=127.0.0.1 origin.port=1812 origin.realm=mobicents.org
# The Remote IP Address, Port and Realm (default: 127.0.0.1 / 3868 / mobicents.org) destination.ip=127.0.0.1 destination.port=3868 destination.realm=mobicents.org
